definition: horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]

sentences.english: China's world champion Xiao Qin won the pommel horse gold medal.
sentences.chinese: 中国的世界冠军肖钦夺得鞍马金牌。

sentences.english: Our school are so small, even can't get in a pommelled horse.
sentences.chinese: 我们的校园很小，放不下一个鞍马。

sentences.english: There are traces of painted lacquer decoration on the slide, and of gold on the pommel.
sentences.chinese: 有滑动的痕迹装饰画上了漆，并在鞍马金牌。

sentences.english: France , which also competed on the vault, was second after the first rotation.
sentences.chinese: 法国，也选择了鞍马，在第一轮比赛中排列第二。

sentences.english: So that we can better understand and appreciate the art of the Tang Dynasty horse.
sentences.chinese: 使我们能更好得体会和领略到唐代鞍马艺术的面貌。

sentences.english: The vault is similar to the pommel horse but taller.
sentences.chinese: 跳马与鞍马相似，只不过更高一点。

sentences.english: He swings the pommel horse well.
Biology pharmacy also is not " desolate pommelled horse is rare before the door ".
sentences.chinese: 生物制药也并非“门前冷落鞍马稀”。

sentences.english: Teng was very sad . But he knew he had to prepare for the pommel hourse.
sentences.chinese: 螣很沮丧，但是他知道自己还要准备参加鞍马的比赛。

sentences.english: Get a vaulting horse and a trampoline.

definition: expert in a specialized field such as medicine, divination or chess, available on call to the emperor (in the Tang and Song dynasties)
court lady/palace maid/traditional painting of beautiful women
accurate depiction of architectural forms with the aid of a ruler (technique of Chinese art)/picture created using this technique
(literary) palanquin/sedan chair/to ride in a palanquin
the emperor's hand/variant of 馭手|驭手[yu4 shou3]
